construction: This half wave voltage doubler uses two capacitors (C1 and C2), two diodes (D1 and D2) to put a voltage across a load resistor (RL).  Their values are:
Knee voltage of D1 and D2: 0.7 (put this directly into the expressions for the diodes)
You are given the nodes for the AC voltage generator.  Make a model to graph the output voltage (Output V).

givenModelNodes.name: V across C1
givenModelNodes.explanation: When this quantity is positive, the right side of the capacitor has a higher voltage than the left side.

givenModelNodes.name: V across D2
givenModelNodes.explanation: This is the actual voltage drop across D2, which depends on whether it is forward biased or not.

givenModelNodes.name: V2
givenModelNodes.description: Voltage at junction of C1, D2 and D3
givenModelNodes.explanation: This is the voltage with respect to ground at the junction between C1, D1 and D2.

givenModelNodes.name: V across D1 when open
givenModelNodes.description: Voltage drop across diode D1 when reversed biased

givenModelNodes.name: I thru RL from C2
givenModelNodes.description: Current thru load resist from C2

givenModelNodes.name: V across D2 when open
givenModelNodes.description: Voltage drop across diode D2 when reversed biased
givenModelNodes.explanation: If diode D1 were an open circuit (i.e., reverse biased), then this would be the voltage across it, measured from the top (cathode) to the bottom (anode).

schemas.name: Half Wave Voltage Doubler Behavior
schemas.nodes: id4, id5, id6, id7, id8, id25, id24, id23, id22, id21, id20, id19, id18, id16, id15, id11, id10, id9
